title: Ivanka Trump, Jared Kushner visit Western Wall
shortDescription: Jared Kushner and special envoy Steve Witkoff visited the Western Wall before the planned hostage release included in the Israel-Hamas ceasefire.

title: Melania Trump says Russia will return Ukrainian children 18 and older
shortDescription: First lady Melania Trump said she has been communicating with Vladimir Putin's government about reuniting Ukrainian children with their families.

title: Trump warns China over rare-earth controls
shortDescription: President Donald Trump accused China of rare-earth export controls and floated retaliating with tariffs.

title: Trump begins mass layoffs of federal workers amid government shutdown
shortDescription: President Trump on Friday followed through on his long-standing threat to layoff federal workers during the government shutdown.

title: When will Trump return to Mar-a-Lago? Season starts soon
shortDescription: President Donald Trump reportedly returning to Mar-a-Lago for a fundraiser Oct. 17. The season in Palm Beach usually ramps up around Thanksgiving.

title: Trump threatens China with 'massive' tariff hike in warning to Xi
shortDescription: President Trump accused China of seeking a world monopoly on rare earth minerals, vowing the United States will respond financially.

title: Trump's perceived Nobel Peace Prize snub irks White House
shortDescription: "The Nobel Committee proved they place politics over peace," White House Communications Director Steven Cheung wrote on social media.

title: What Trump's Nobel Peace Prize snub means
shortDescription: USA TODAY's Washington bureau chief Susan Page analyzes what a Nobel Peace Prize snub means for President Donald Trump.

title: White House says mass layoffs have begun: Shutdown updates
shortDescription: The federal government shutdown rolled on to Day 10 on Friday as Donald Trump and congressional Republicans and Democrats still cannot reach a deal.

title: Daily Briefing: Trump foes indicted
shortDescription: New York Attorney General Letitia James faces charges. Here is the news to know on Friday.

title: Donald Trump does not win the Nobel Peace Prize, but winner thanks him
shortDescription: Trump said he deserved the Nobel Peace Prize for his role in resolving various world conflicts. The winner thanked Trump for supporting her cause.

title: NY Dems rally around Letitia James after bank fraud indictment
shortDescription: The defense of James by fellow New York Democrats marked a stark contrast from New York City Mayor Eric Adams' prosecution just over a year ago.

title: Israeli government approves hostage-release phase of Trump plan
shortDescription: The approval of the framework by the Israeli government paves the way for Hamas-held hostages to be released.

title: Trump says he's in 'great shape'
shortDescription: President Donald Trump is set to undergo a medical checkup at Walter Reed Medical Center, in what will be the president's second exam there this year.

title: Longtime Trump foe Letitia James indicted for bank fraud
shortDescription: New York AG Letitia James was indicted Oct. 9, less than three weeks after President Donald Trump publicly called for her to face charges.
